data.title: Unexplained incident takes life of freshman at John Adams in South Bend
data.meta_description: Police say there was nothing suspicious or criminal about the incident. The South Bend school districts is providing counselors to the students.
data.text:
Freshman at John Adams High School dies Monday morning in "health-related incident"

SOUTH BEND ― A freshman at John Adams High School died early Monday morning in what’s being described as an “isolated health-related incident.”

School officials would not release the age or the gender of the student, who was given immediate medical attention at the school and then transported to the hospital, according to a statement released by South Bend Community School Corp.

The incident, which occurred at the start of the school day but before classes were underway, was witnessed by students, faculty and staff.

“Our hearts go out to the family as well as the staff and students at Adams High School,” the release said. “While we are grieving, we are doing everything we can to support all students, as we know this will have a profound impact on the Adams student body.”

Social workers and counselors have been brought in to help students and staff through the grieving process, according to the school district. In addition, the school’s administration can provide additional school and community resources.

School officials didn't release additional details.

"There is nothing to suggest that there was anything suspicious or criminal in nature, but we will continue to work with the school district and the coroner's office throughout the process," said Ashley O'Chap, public information officer for South Bend Police Department.
